about.name: WORLD POULTRY SCIENCE ASSOCIATION - MACEDONIAN BRANCH
about.nameWithoutDashes: WORLD POULTRY SCIENCE ASSOCIATION MACEDONIAN BRANCH

goals.title: Goals of the Association
goals.description: The Association primarily focuses on the concept of economically acceptable and sustainable development and adapted concept for the protection, promotion, and development of poultry science and the poultry industry. The Association will promote all theoretical knowledge and practical experiences that help realize and advance the basic goals and tasks.

points.advancement: Promotion of advancement of knowledge in all aspects of poultry science and the poultry industry
points.congresses: Promotion of World Poultry Congresses, as well as local and regional meetings
points.gatherings: Organizing professional and scientific gatherings through lectures, public appearances, round tables, forums, and other appropriate means
points.informing: Informing the public about the activities of the Association through social networks and other methods
points.projects: Development and implementation of scientific national and international projects in the field of poultry
points.dissemination: Dissemination of knowledge in all branches of the poultry industry and facilitating the exchange of economic activities of the Association through organizing scientific meetings, seminars, and lectures, as well as publishing activities

mission.title: Mission and Vision
mission.visionDeclaration: The vision of the Citizens Association World Poultry Science Association - Macedonian Branch Skopje is:
mission.visionContent: To have a high national and international reputation and trust promoting the concept of one health
mission.missionDeclaration: The mission of the Citizens Association World Poultry Science Association - Macedonian Branch Skopje is:
mission.missionContent: To facilitate the exchange of ideas, projects, and initiatives between science, education, and industry in poultry

membership.title: Membership
membership.description: Membership in the association is voluntary.

regular.title: Regular
regular.description: Any individual who is 18 years or older

student.title: Student
student.description: Individuals enrolled in undergraduate, graduate or doctoral studies in the relevant scientific field. Student members do not pay membership fees

honorary.title: Honorary
honorary.description: Individuals who have been selected by the Assembly of the Association for special merits, following a proposal by the President

associate.title: Associate
associate.description: Any legal entity that helps and supports the Association's operations

membership.fee: Members pay membership fees (except student members) by April 30th each year. The amount of the membership fee is determined by the Assembly based on the President's proposal.

bio.p1: Aleksandar Dodovski, PhD, MSc, DVM, is a professor at Ss. Cyril and Methodius University in Skopje, Faculty of Veterinary Medicine. With over two decades of experience in veterinary science, he specializes in avian diseases, diagnostics, and epidemiology. Throughout his career, he has advanced through various academic roles, contributing to scientific research, innovations, and veterinary education.
bio.p2: Dr. Dodovski has authored numerous peer-reviewed publications and has played a crucial role in international projects related to avian virology and disease control. He was instrumental in the successful accreditation of advanced laboratory methods for disease diagnostics, enhancing veterinary capabilities in Macedonia. He provides expert advice to the Food and Veterinary Agency and collaborates closely with stakeholders in the agro-food sector.
bio.p3: Passionate about advancing poultry science, he is dedicated to research, education, and fostering collaboration in the field. As President of the Macedonian Branch of the World Poultry Science Association, he continues to influence veterinary science and policy.

bio.p1: Tanja Kotevska is a dynamic and results-driven professional with over two decades of experience spanning agricultural development, business leadership, and strategic marketing. As Development Manager at Greenagro, she spearheads educational initiatives to advance sustainable farming practices, blending modern innovation with agro-ecological principles to empower farming communities. Concurrently, she owns and operates TIV 5 DOOEL Skopje, a thriving pet service center, demonstrating entrepreneurial versatility.
bio.p2: Her tenure at Unilever SCE as a marketing executive across South-Central Europe honed her expertise in brand strategy, cross-functional collaboration, and market trend analysis. A lifelong learner, Tanja holds certifications in leadership, project management, and psychology, complementing her Bachelor's degree in Humanities and Social Sciences. Fluent in English and adept in digital tools, she merges creative problem-solving with operational excellence to drive growth in diverse sectors—from agriculture to consumer goods—while championing sustainability, education, and community impact.

bio.p1: Biography for Aleksandar Dovlev to be added.

Dr. Marjan Tanevski, is a veterinarian with nineteen years of poultry industry experience. Commenced his career in 2006 at a Macedonian poultry production company as a hatchery and breeding flock manager.
bio.p2: His responsibilities encompassed all hatchery operations, including product, personnel, and equipment management, and he ensured staff compliance with industry standards. He currently owns a Macedonian poultry hatchery dedicated to producing high-quality day-old chicks.

bio.p1: Milan Popchevski, DVM is a dedicated veterinary professional specializing in farm animal nutrition, with a focus on poultry and pigs. He graduated from the Faculty of Veterinary Medicine in Skopje in 2007.
bio.p2: With over a decade of experience, Dr. Popchevski has worked extensively in animal nutrition, biosecurity, and farm management. From 2010 to 2013, he contributed to the establishment of HACCP procedures at the Rudine dairy factory. He then served as Director of Ravago Macedonia (2013–2023), where he provided consulting in feed, nutrition, and biosecurity. Currently, through his company VETFUD Consulting, he advises poultry, swine, and fish farms on improving animal health and performance through tailored nutritional strategies.
bio.p3: His contributions to animal nutrition, particularly in optimizing feed supplements for improved growth performance and overall farm health, play a crucial role in advancing modern livestock management.

partners.title: PARTNERS & RESOURCES
partners.description: The Macedonian Branch of the World Poultry Science Association collaborates with numerous national and international organizations, educational institutions, and industry partners to advance poultry science in Macedonia and beyond. Below are some of our key partners and resources.

wpsa.name: World's Poultry Science Association
wpsa.description: International organization dedicated to advancing poultry science globally.

europeanFederation.description: Coordinating body for European WPSA branches.

join.title: Join Us
join.description: We welcome new members who are interested in poultry science and the poultry industry. By joining WPSA Macedonian Branch, you'll gain access to a network of professionals, educational resources, and opportunities to collaborate on research projects.
